definition:
Let $H$ be a bialgebra. A **right $H$-comodule algebra** is a unital
algebra $A$ which is a right $H$-comodule satisfying
$$t(ab) = t(a)t(b) = \sum a_{(1)}b_{(1)} \otimes a_{(2)}b_{(2)}, \quad
t({\mathord{\mathrm{1\!\!\!\:I}}}_A) = {\mathord{\mathrm{1\!\!\!\:I}}}_A\otimes{\mathord{\mathrm{1\!\!\!\:I}}}_H,$$
for all $h \in H$ and $a,b \in A$.

There is a dual notion of a $H$-module coalgebra.

Let $H$ be a bialgebra. Then $H$ is itself a $H$-comodule algebra for
the right regular coaction $t(h) = \Delta(h)$.
